overview:
Judith Meskill is COO for Change.org.

Judith Meskill is a social media evangelist and virtual workforce visionary, whose recent engagements include serving as Vice President & Social Media Officer with BabyCenter, LLC, a Johnson & Johnson company, and General Manager/COO of Weblogs, Inc., an AOL company. Judith is adept at orchestrating large, geographically dispersed groups of employees, contractors, and freelancers. An ardent social networking practitioner, she is constantly investigating “what works” and “what doesn’t work” in the evolving world of online social systems and collaborative tools.

Bringing both depth and breadth of experience to her engagements â€“ Judith’s experience serving as a founding team member for successful internet start-up companies includes: Pacific Bell Internet Services, SBC Internet Services, and Weblogs, Inc. Her leadership background spans technology and operational strategies, virtual workforce management, social media systems and online service delivery and support. With advanced studies in Artificial Intelligence and Knowledge Management at Stanford, Judith deepened her skill in strengthening online experiences with knowledge-based systems.

In her daily journey through the vast plethora of emerging ‘social’ services, Judith can be found photo-blogging on her twitwall, following friends on Facebook, networking on LinkedIn, uploading macro/nature photos on Flickr, sharing music on last.fm, and twittering into the ether with her ‘green’ and social media cohorts.

Judith’s speaking engagements, on the influence of social networking and personal knowledge strategies on business practices, include â€“ SWINY, The Columbia Journalism Review and Consumer Reports, MIXX, BlogOn, iDate, Internet World, KMWorld, Seybold San Francisco and SUPERNOVA.
